title: Multicollector isotope ratio mass spectrometry: New frontiers in soil microbiology and biogeochemistry
abstractText: Abstracts are not currently available in GtR for all funded research. This is normally because the abstract was not required at the time of proposal submission, but may be because it included sensitive information such as personal details.
impactText:
Multicollector isotope ratio mass spectrometer used as prototype by collaborator Sercon Ltd. 
Academic impact. Agriculture, Food and Drink,Environment,Manufacturing, including Industrial Biotechology Economic
findingsText: First mass spectrometer in UK for measurement of position of 15N in N2O molecule from one sample injection. This provides advance in ability to determine microbial processes producing N2O in situ, and particularly beneficial in unfertilised systems. Academic uptake.
